name: dbxref.txt
description: Databases cross-referenced in HTS-CSRS Biocompute Objects
title: High-Throughput Sequencing Computational Standards for Regulatory Sciences(HTS-CSRS) Knowlegebase.
sponsored_by: George Washington University Washington, DC, USA
US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) Silverspring, MD, USA
notes: This document lists all the databases that are cross referenced in HTS-CSRS. The databases that are specifically mentioned in the 'web resource' comment topic of HTS-CSRS are not listed.
Databases are listed in XR lines which are used as resources for information related to biocompute entries and are found in resources other than HTS-CSRS.
The recordUrl field allows to access an entry in the cross referenced database by substituting the '%s' in the url with an object ID from that DB.

objs.name: HIVE
objs.title: High-performance integrated virtual environment
objs.description: HIVE is a cloud-based environment optimized for the storage and analysis of extra-large data.

objs.name: NucCore
objs.title: Nucleotide
objs.description: Sequence database of all publicly available DNA sequences

objs.name: DO
objs.title: Disease-Ontology, standardized ontology for human disease

objs.name: ICD
objs.title: International Classification of Disease (Tenth Edition)
objs.description: A database that consists of all clinical codes

objs.name: SRA
objs.title: Sequence Read Archive
objs.description: A database that stores raw sequencing data and alignment information

objs.name: KEGG
objs.title: Kyoto Encyclopedia of Genes and Genomes
objs.description: A database resource for understanding high-level and utilities of the biological system

objs.name: OMIM
objs.title: Online Mendalian Inheritance in Man
objs.description: Database of human genes and genetic phenotypes

objs.name: ORCID
objs.title: Open Researcher and Contributor ID
objs.description: Repository that stores codes that uniquely identify scientific and other academic authors and contributors

objs.name: SO
objs.title: Sequence Ontology
objs.description: SO is a collaborative ontology project for the definition of sequence features used in biological sequence annotation.

objs.name: taxID
objs.title: Taxonomy
objs.description: Sequence database of all publicly available DNA sequences

objs.name: PubChem
objs.title: PubChem Compound
objs.description: The PubChem Compound Database contains validated chemical depiction information provided to describe substances in PubChem Substance.

objs.name: UBERON
objs.title: Uberon
objs.description: Uberon is an integrated cross-species ontology covering anatomical structures in animals.
